intro: Oenothera crassifolia, commonly known as the thickleaf evening primrose, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Its flowers emit a mild fragrance and are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera crassifolia is also valued for its ornamental qualities and resilience in challenging soils.
